Certainly! Here are a few wineries you might consider visiting along the Route des Grands Crus:

1. Domaine Pavelot: This family-owned winery in Savigny-lès-Beaune is known for its reds, especially its Pinot Noir. Visitors can take a tour of the winery and sample some of its wines. 2. Domaine de la Vougeraie: This winery, located in Premeaux-Prissey, is known for its biodynamic wines, which are made using natural techniques that are designed to preserve the integrity of the grape. Visitors can tour the winery and vineyard, as well as sample some of its wines. 3. Domaine de la Romanee-Conti: This legendary winery in Vosne-Romanée produces some of the most exclusive and expensive wines in the world. Visits are by appointment only, but if you can get a reservation, it's an experience you won't forget. 4. Louis Jadot: Founded in the mid-19th century, this winery has become one of the most respected names in Burgundy wine. Visitors can tour its facilities in Beaune and sample some of its many wines. 5. Domaine des Hospices de Beaune: This winery is owned by the Hospices de Beaune, a charitable hospital founded in the 15th century. The winery's profits go to support the hospital's charitable work. Visitors can tour the winery and sample some of its red and white wines. I hope this list helps you plan your trip and discover some of the amazing wineries along the Route des Grands Crus!
